avalancheActivity.comment: A small slab was reported in Bláfjöll on February 22nd along with small sloughs and cornice fall.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Thawing has affected the snowpack up to the mountain tops, and a significant amount of snow has melted. The snowpack is now uniform and has strengthened in colder weather. Small wind slabs may have formed in in depressions and gullies during W-directions.

snowpackStructure.highlights: A significant amount of snow has melted during thaw on Sunday and Monday. During freezing on Tuesday, the snowpack strengthened again. Since then, there has been light snowfall in the area, and small wind slabs may have formed in east-facing gullies and valleys.

travelAdvisory.comment: It has snowed this week and windslabs could be present in the Eastfjords and Westfjords. The new snow has not formed windslabs yet in the north but it is bonding poorly with the old snow and a few avalanches have occurred there. The old snowpack is likely becoming stronger after thaw and freeze cycles. Weaknesses in the upper snowpack have likely disappeared due to the thaw, but deeper weaknesses higher in the mountains could still be present in the North part of the country.
travelAdvisory.highlights: The new snow is bonding poorly to older snow in the north part of Iceland and a few avalanches have occurred there. Windslabs could have formed in the Westfjords and Eastfjords.

weatherForecast.highlights: Úrkomulaust og -8 til -10 stig á fimmtudag, hæg norðanátt en hvessir á föstudag.

avalancheActivity.comment: A few wet avalanches occurred during the thaw on Monday. A few avalanches occurred last week.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Small windslabs could be present on SW-aspects.

snowpackStructure.highlights: The thaw on Monday reached to high elevations. Snowfall on Tuesday during strong NE-winds might have formed windslabs on SW-aspects. The underlying snowpack has most likely become rather stable. A little snow is forecasted on Thursday during NE winds.

travelAdvisory.comment: It has snowed this week and windslabs could be present in the Eastfjords and Westfjords. The new snow has not formed windslabs yet in the north but it is bonding poorly with the old snow and a few avalanches have occurred there. The old snowpack is likely becoming stronger after thaw and freeze cycles. Weaknesses in the upper snowpack have likely disappeared due to the thaw, but deeper weaknesses higher in the mountains could still be present in the North part of the country.
travelAdvisory.highlights: The new snow is bonding poorly to older snow in the north part of Iceland and a few avalanches have occurred there. Windslabs could have formed in the Westfjords and Eastfjords.

weatherForecast.highlights: NA-læg átt á fimmtudag og föstudag líkur á dálítilli snjókomu. Á laugardag er útlit fyrir hæglátt og úrkomulítið veður.

avalancheActivity.comment: Two avalanches released in Illviðrishnjúkur following snowfall on Tuesday, sized between 2 and 2.5. Several small slabs also fell in the area, along with small slabs in Ólafsfjörður. There was considerable avalanche activity in the region before the weekend and during the thaw on Monday. A slab avalanche was reported in Klaufabrekkuskarð, sized 2.5.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Update 29.2.: New snow in light winds on Tuesday, followed by several avalanches and unstable wind slabs are widespread. The thaw on Monday affected the snowpack up to the mountain peaks, but stiffened and strengthened as it froze again on Tuesday.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Unstable wind slabs are present on south- and east-facing slopes after snowfall on Tuesday. Snow tests indicated fractures under light to moderate loads on the new snow. Thaw on Monday has influenced snow in all elevations, but has now stiffened and strengthened. A deep persistent weakness, beneath layered snow on older crust, is still present, although stability tests last weekend showed fractures under moderate to heavy loads on that layer. Propagation saw tests indicated that the layer fractures easily, and faceted crystals are still present although starting to round. It will likely require significant stress for avalanches to release on that layer, as the upper layers have stiffened and bridged the lower layers.

travelAdvisory.comment: It has snowed this week and windslabs could be present in the Eastfjords and Westfjords. The new snow has not formed windslabs yet in the north but it is bonding poorly with the old snow and a few avalanches have occurred there. The old snowpack is likely becoming stronger after thaw and freeze cycles. Weaknesses in the upper snowpack have likely disappeared due to the thaw, but deeper weaknesses higher in the mountains could still be present in the North part of the country.
travelAdvisory.highlights: The new snow is bonding poorly to older snow in the north part of Iceland and a few avalanches have occurred there. Windslabs could have formed in the Westfjords and Eastfjords.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hæglætisveður, kalt og úrkomulítið um land allt á fimmtudag en lítilsháttar éljagangur á Norðurlandi. Hvessir í N-átt á föstudag.

avalancheActivity.comment: A skier triggered a slab avalanche in Stafdalur on Feb 25th. Older avalanches can be found in Norðfjörður and Fagridalur.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Windslabs are present. It snowed on Tuesday during strong W/NW wind with further windslab formation, especially on S-E aspects.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Layered windslabs are present on most aspects after variable winds. The bond between layers in the windslabs could be unstable. It snowed on Tuesday during W/NW winds which will most likely formed windslabs on S-E aspects.

travelAdvisory.comment: It has snowed this week and windslabs could be present in the Eastfjords and Westfjords. The new snow has not formed windslabs yet in the north but it is bonding poorly with the old snow and a few avalanches have occurred there. The old snowpack is likely becoming stronger after thaw and freeze cycles. Weaknesses in the upper snowpack have likely disappeared due to the thaw, but deeper weaknesses higher in the mountains could still be present in the North part of the country.
travelAdvisory.highlights: The new snow is bonding poorly to older snow in the north part of Iceland and a few avalanches have occurred there. Windslabs could have formed in the Westfjords and Eastfjords.

weatherForecast.highlights: N/NV- áttir á fimmtudag og föstudag og líkur á dálítilli snjókomu. Útlit fyrir svipað veður á laugardag. Áfram kalt í veðri.
